title.rendered: 🚨 3 Common WordPress Errors & How to Fix Them (Save Time & Sanity!)

content.rendered:
As a WordPress developer, I’ve squashed these errors countless times. Bookmark this guide for quick fixes!

1. The White Screen of Death
What happens: Your site shows a blank white page.
Why it happens: Plugin/theme conflicts, memory limits, or corrupted PHP files.

🛠️ Fixes:
1. Enable debugging: Add these lines to `wp-config.php`:
“`php
define(‘WP_DEBUG’, true);
define(‘WP_DEBUG_LOG’, true);
“`
Check `wp-content/debug.log` for error clues.
2. Disable plugins: Rename the `plugins` folder to `plugins_old` via FTP.
3. Switch themes: Temporarily activate a default theme like Twenty Twenty-Four.

🔒 Prevention: Always test plugins/themes on a staging site first!

2. Internal Server Error (500)
What happens: A generic “500 error” message appears.
Why it happens: Corrupted `.htaccess` file, plugin issues, or PHP version mismatches.

🛠️ Fixes:
1. Reset `.htaccess`:
– Delete your existing `.htaccess` file.
– Go to *Settings > Permalinks* and click “Save” to regenerate it.
2. Increase PHP memory: Add this to `wp-config.php`:
“`php
define(‘WP_MEMORY_LIMIT’, ‘256M’);
“`
3. Check PHP version: Ensure your hosting supports PHP 8.0+ (WordPress recommends 8.2).

🔒 Prevention: Use a plugin like Health Check & Troubleshooting to monitor conflicts.

3. “Error Establishing a Database Connection”
What happens: Your site can’t connect to the database.
Why it happens: Incorrect database credentials, corrupted tables, or server overload.

🛠️ Fixes:
1. Verify credentials: Check `wp-config.php` for correct DB_NAME, DB_USER, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_HOST.
2. Repair the database: Add this to `wp-config.php`:
“`php
define(‘WP_ALLOW_REPAIR’, true);
“`
Visit `https://lnkd.in/de3fg4fQ.
3. Contact your host: Server-side issues (e.g., MySQL downtime) might require their help.

🔒 Prevention: Schedule regular database backups with UpdraftPlus or your hosting tool.

BONUS TIP:
Always clear your cache after making changes! Plugins like WP Rocket or your browser’s cache can hide fixes.
